title: Bypassing screen unlock to "Hey Google, ring my phone"
content:
On Google Pixel 4a. I cannot for my life find the right place to ask so I'm just asking here.

Sometimes I can't find my phone, and I call out by saying "Hey Google" and locate it by the ding, but it can sometimes be pretty faint especially when it'a far away.

I read that you can tell it to "ring my phone", so I tried it - and it prompts a screen unlock using keypin/fingerprint before it will ring, which doesn't make sense because I'd be in a situation where I CAN'T unlock my phone because I don't know where it is.

How do I bypass the screen unlock?
category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 4a
